name: Circumference of a Circle
explanation: The circumference (perimeter) of a circle is 2π times the radius, or π times the diameter. This formula shows that circumference is directly proportional to radius—doubling the radius doubles the circumference. The constant π (pi) is approximately 3.14159 and represents the ratio of circumference to diameter for any circle.
